intro: Capsella gracilescens, commonly known as the slender knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many well-known garden plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Capsella gracilescens is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
